reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time visiting the cenit and Ibiza and I would definitely return. this is a very pleasant gay friendly hotel, situated between the bars/restaurants of figueretas and the vibrant Ibiza town, both of which are about 10 minutes walk away via narrow roads and quite a few steps, (about 4 flights down to the the main stretch to Ibiza town).
reviews.title: gay ibiza
Friendly and reliable
reviews.text: we found the room we stayed in to be of a good standard, especially the bathroom which was very modern. the hotel is split into two parts, the hotel itself and the apartments across the road. there is a modest swimming pool and bar on the roof of the apartment area which we found to be very chilled with stunning views across the sea. the bar staff were also very friendly and helpful,. downsides, (very few)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: breakfast was included in the price but was only continental, doors tended to echo in the corridors a little when guests arrive or leave there rooms and only one English tv channel (but we didn't come to watch telly anyways).
reviews.title: Second time here and now with a refurb

reviews.text: this hotel is worth more than its 2*, we had a great time and thank you to all the staff, especially pedro at the pool bar who was very helpful in spending time with us, helping us to decide which bars to visit :-)
reviews.title: Great ibiza Hotel

reviews.text: Our fourth stay in the Cenit. It's location is fantastic... 15 minutes in a cab from the airport... 10 minute walk to the old town - perfect for a relaxing break. It's a basic hotel but the atmosphere is great and many rooms have a superb view. Roof top bar is always fun and the same staff work there and in the hotel year after year.
reviews.title: Basic Value

reviews.text: Ibiza is a typically very expensive place to vacation. The Cenit Hotel offers a nice and spacious room, with a small kitchenette. I stayed in a room that had a balcony that looked out to the sea. It wasn't decorated in a fancy way. There was not a TV, nor a phone in the room. Didn't need or miss either. They have a beautiful horizon level pool, with a nice bar next to it. Seems to be popular for several of the local gay population. They also offer a nice and simple breakfast buffet. Internet connection was not available in the room, but there was a good signal in the hotel lobby, and on the porch in front of the hotel
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Value

reviews.text: Hotel Cenit, sits on top of the hill in Ibiza town. It is a great hotel, nothing fancy but it is clean and has everything you need. The pool is gorgeous, it sits on top of the cliff face, overlooking Ibiza. The view is worth a million dollars. The hotel seems to attract the gay male crowd, for a group of girls travelling on their own, this is perfect. Everyone is very sweet and welcoming. The ladies on front reception were extremely friendly and helpful. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Ibiza. I will definitely be staying there again.
reviews.title: Great hotel, pool and location!

reviews.text: Check-in staff unhelpful. We were allocated room 101 (how apt) which must be one of the worst rooms in the hotel. No window, small, dated interior and rat bate on the balcony. We had booked this months ahead so would expect better. Asked to moved and told no available rooms all week. Holidays are too short so we went over the newly refurbished ebeso and booked 6 nights there at great expense. The one night in room was terrible. Hot as you had to pay for Aircon and really noisy. It felt like we were in a prison block. When we checked reception staff were not the slightest concerned and didn't refund what we'd paid in advance for the safe. We booked this through Thompson holidays and they should be embarrassed that this is what their customers are allocated. Avoid.
reviews.title: Ensure you know what room you are getting before you book.

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel mid May for one week. The hotel was relatively quiet and I was given a very nice large room (202) overlooking the sea. It appeared to have been recently re-decorated and re-furnished and was rather better than i would expect of a 2 * hotel.
reviews.title: Good inexpensive hotel.

reviews.text: The wi-fi only reliably worked in the hotel reception area which was slightly annoying as was having to use a safe in the reception area rather than having one in each room.
reviews.title: Good location for walking to Ibiza Town...all downhill. The walk back is very testing..uphill and hundreds of stairs!!!

reviews.text: Hotel: this is not a luxury hotel but for the money the facilities are amazing. There is a fantastic pool area, with a big pool, a cafe, and the best sea views in Ibiza. The lobby is basic but nice and everything is spotlessly clean. The service was friendly and helpful, especially Alberto in the pool cafe (thanks for being so pleasant and helpful Alberto).
reviews.title: For the price - excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Perfect! Lots of the other reviews says its a long walk up a hill but its not. Its 5 minutes walk to Figueretas beach area, which is lovely, and with loads of good cheap restaurants, and a 15 minute walk to Ibiza town.
reviews.title: A good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: We had a studio which was basic but spacious and spotlessly clean. Unusually for an apartment it was cleaned everyday with fresh towels etc. Most of the rooms have sea views. We were unlucky but it didn't really matter as the view from the pool area is stunning. One gripe - the mattresses were a bit lumpy.
reviews.title: A good hotel, especially if the price is appropriate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Value: at £500 for 7 nights this hotel is great value. I have no hesitation of recommending this hotel. It was a big part of us having an amazing holiday in Ibiza. Stay here.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: PS: Try the Number 43 restaurant on Av. Espanya (5 mins walk from hotel) - best tapas I ever had and completely satisfied for less than 20 euros!).
reviews.title: Very comfortable and convenient

reviews.text: The rooms are very very basic. But it's Ibiza so that's ok as how much time do you spend in the room?
reviews.title: Good for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel common areas such as bar area, pool and breakfast room are lovely.
reviews.title: As good as ever . . . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About a 10 minute walk from the old town.
reviews.title: Hotel Centi

reviews.text: All up, very good value for money and would consider staying again if on a tight budget.
reviews.title: Very basic hotel in Ibiza

reviews.text: Lots and lots of gay guests which is fine but it does make the hotel a bit of a cat walk with every time you walk into a room all eyes lift up and stare!!
reviews.title: Good location, great view ! Short distance from Ibiza town.
